results.title: Babe: pig in the city
results.brief_description: The sequel to the 1995 surprise hit ‘Babe’ moves the action of the first film into the vast unknown of a sprawling metropolis. Along with the radical change comes a surprisingly dark undertone. What launches Babe’s adventure is an unfortunate well accident involving farmer Hoggett. Babe, along with Mrs Hoggett, must then head into the big city to drum up money and save the farm from bankruptcy. Once there the native duo are separated and Babe finds himself in a strange boarding house for animals. Although critics feared the film might have been too intense for kids, Miller’s film is full of compassion, pathos and unexpected poignanacy.

results.title: Alien resurrection
results.creator_credit: Jean-Pierre Jeunet, Walter Hill, David Giler, Gordon Carroll, Bill Badalato and Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation
results.brief_description: Sigourney Weaver reprises her role as Ellen Ripley, a big surprise to most fans considering she died at the end of ‘Alien 3’. In this next instalment of the series a group of scientists succeed in resurrecting Ripley by cloning her. Their main motivation being the Queen Alien which lies dormant within her DNA. Science runs amok however when the alien terror is unwittingly unleased on the scientists spacecraft. The newly revived Ripley (who is a different creature in many respects from her past incarnation), must join forces with a group of smugglers and a mysterious young mechanic named Call (Winona Ryder) to combat the vicious aliens. The strength of the alien saga has always been the constantly evolving character of Ripley and the fresh perspective different creative talents have brought to the series. (Ridley Scott directed the first one, James Cameron the second and David Fincher the third). In this fourth instalment, director Jean-Piere Jeunet (‘City of lost children’, ‘Delicatessen’) populates the film with surreal, womb like imagery, plenty of visceral thrills and a magnificent action sequence set underwater. Cast also includes Ron Perlman, Dan Hedaya, Brad Dourif, Michael Wincott and J.E. Freeman.

results.title: Tank girl
results.creator_credit: Rachel Talalay, John Watson, Pen Densham, Richard Lewis, Trilogy Entertainment Group and United Artists Corporation
results.brief_description: The year is 2033 and water is a precious commodity. In the desolate wind swept plains, animals are banned, bathing is unheard of, and the Water & Power Company, headed by the villainous Kesslee (Malcolm McDowell), have ultimate control over the precious H20. One rebel girl stands in their way, Rebecca (Lori Petty), a chick with attitude and an outrageous hairstyle. She is captured by Water & Power when they kill her boyfriend, kidnap her young friend, and try to blackmail her into joining their team. As a prisoner Rebecca discovers a new passion- tanks, and makes a friend with mechanic and pilot, Jet Girl (Naomi Watts), who helps her escape. Once free the girls join forces with The Rippers, an army of half men and half kangaroos, genetically modified to be the ultimate fighting machines. Together they take Water & Power head on, lead by Jet Girl in the sky, and tank girl on the ground with her beloved tank in a flurry of live action and comic strip visuals. Cast also includes Ice-T, Don Harvey and Jeff Kober.

results.title: Happy Gilmore
results.creator_credit: Dennis Dugan, Robert Simonds, MCA/Universal Home Video and MCA/Universal
results.brief_description: Happy Gilmore has an anger management problem, which could be really helpful if he could achieve his dream of becoming a professional ice hockey player. However he is a lousy skater. When his beloved grandmother loses her home to the IRS he desperately tries to find a way to raise the money. Quite by accident he discovers that his hockey slap shot translates to an amazingly accurate 400 yard golf tee shot. So he decides to join the pro golf tour, brining his ferocious temper and outlandish antics to the well-tended fairways. Before long he is a media sensation, attracting hordes of followers and news cameras wherever he goes. A rivalry between Happy and nasty golf pro ‘Shooter’ heats up, resulting in a riotous confrontation on the once-hallowed golf links.

results.title: Mystic pizza
results.creator_credit: Donald Petrie, Scott Rosenfelt, Mark Levinson and Samuel Goldwyn Company
results.brief_description: Friends Kat, Daisy and Jojo share their insecurities, dreams and aspirations as they work at Mystic Pizza, a successful pizzeria in small town Mystic. Kat (Annabeth Gish) is sensible and intelligent, holding down 4 part time jobs to finance her way through next year’s astronomy course and about to become involved with a married man. Daisy (Julia Roberts in her first major screen role), Kat’s sister, is promiscuous and sexy, arguing with her mother who wants her to “calm down” and involved with rich kid Charlie in a possible rags to riches romance. Jojo (Lili Taylor) is engaged to fishmonger Bill but is suffering from pre-wedding jitters and her healthy libido is at odds with Bill’s catholic conscience. All three of them want to make something of their lives - perhaps get out of Mystic, and all three of them are determined to remain friends forever. Cast also includes William R Moses, Vincent D’Onofrio, Adam Storke and Conchata Ferrell.

results.title: Bright lights, big city
results.creator_credit: James Bridges, Sydney Pollack, Mark Rosenberg and United Artists Corporation
results.brief_description: When his model wife, Amanda (Phoebe Cates) leaves him, aspiring writer Jamie Conway (Michael J. Fox) plunges into a downward spiral of drugs and alcohol on the Manhattan nightclub scene, ably assisted by his sleazy, yuppie friend Allagash (Kiefer Sutherland). Providing some sort of continuity to dreary days en route to nightly excess is the tabloid story of the plight of a coma baby which parallels Jamie’s fragile existence since his mother died and Amanda left him. With the help of Allagash’s cousin (Michael J. Fox’s wife, Tracy Pollan), a persistent younger brother (Charlie Schlatter), and a well meaning colleague (Swoosie Kurtz), there may be hope for Jamie’s salvation. “Bright lights, big city” is one of Fox’s few attempts to break his comic/Mr Nice Guy persona (“Casualties of war” being another example), and did so to mixed receptions. Based on the book by Jay McInerney.

results.title: The Fate of Lee Khan [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit: King Hu, Golden Harvest and King Hu Film Productions
results.brief_description: A martial arts historical epic of deceit, vengeance, treachery and bloody retribution. In 1366 Yuan dynasty China is ruled by Mongol invaders. Lee Khan, a ruthless, decadent aristocrat and master swordsman, and his beautiful but heartless sister, attempt defend their corrupt legacy of privilege and power. They face defeat when group of Chinese national revolutionaries organize and wage a great uprising against their Mongolian oppressors. Cast includes Angela Mao, Hsu Feng, Roy Chiao. In Cantonese with English subtitles.

results.title: Maidens in uniform = Girls in uniform = Madchen in uniform
results.creator_credit: Leontine Sagan, Carl Froelich and Deutsche Filmgemeinschaft
results.brief_description: Central to the film, set in a boarding school for the daughters of German officers prior to World War I, is the intense relationship between a young student and her female teacher. Interwoven emotional and institutional pressures result in near tragedy. The atmosphere of Prussian authoritarianism in the school is expertly evoked and the film has long been seen as an attack on German militarism and was suppressed by the Nazis. Causing an uproar on its release because of its frank handling of lesbianism, it was rediscovered in the seventies and has now taken its place as a classic of gay cinema. Director Leontine Sagan had been trained by Max Reinhardt and was already a prominent stage actress. Soon afterwards she came to England to direct a film for Alexander Korda. Cast includes Dorothea Wieck, Hertha Thiele, Emilia Unda and Ellen Schwannecke. In German with English subtitles.

results.title: Of mice and men
results.creator_credit: Gary Sinise, Russ Smith and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
results.brief_description: John Malkovich and Gary Sinise both deliver powerhouse performances in this adaptation of John Steinbeck’s classic tale of doomed friendship set in the Great Depression. Best friends Lennie (Malkovich) and George (Sinise) find themselves unemployed and unable to keep stable employment for long, due to Lennie’s infantile mental capacity. Their luck seems to change as they are hired at the Tyler Ranch, although they must endure the over-zealous supervision by the boss’s son, Curley (Casey Siemaszko). After settling in and making friends, their world is torn asunder by tragedy when Curley’s unhappy wife (Sherilyn Fenn) becomes the innocent victim of Lennie’s compassion.

results.title: Dark angel
results.creator_credit: Robert Iscove, Elisa Kohn Taub, Big Ticket Television and Spelling Entertainment
results.brief_description: In this made-for-television action thriller, a homicide detective who has been transferred from the Baton Rouge police department to New Orleans under mysterious circumstances is linked to a serial killer who preys on adulterous women. His new superiors assign a female detective to investigate him forcing him to confront his past in order to prove himself innocent before more women are killed. Cast includes Eric Roberts, Ashley Crow, Gina Torres, Linden Ashby.
